cab.content: The attached statement has been prepared inconjunction with the Controller on the basis of tablesprovided by the Director of Statistics. The matter is of such importance that it isthought that it should be brought to the notice of theWar Cabinet at once.(Intld). L. H. Third Sea Lord 7.6.17.THE SECRETARY, WAR CABINET. The fact emerges from table MH" that the larger vessels are more liable to be hit by torpedoes than smaller ships of the same speed. This confirms the opinion I expressed to the War Cabinet that we- should not continue building the vessels of 5,000 tons gross and over. d (Sgd). J. R. Jellicoe, First Sea Lord and Chief of the Naval Staff. 8.6,17. sm-QEJHBB^KT SHIES,Memorandum by Third Sea Lord for the information of the War Cabinet. An analysis of the sinkings by submarine attack upto May 31st. 1917 has been made and is sent herewith. Itshews that the preponderance of vulnerability is in vesselsof between 1,000 and 7,000 gross tons and below 12 knotsnominal speed. Vessels of between 1,000 and 7,000 tons account for - In Tonnage. In Numbers. 72.7 f0 44.5 % (of the total British (Mercantile Marine in (1914. 81o5 % 82.0 % fof the total (sinkings. If we further analyse the sinkings in this groupwe find that - 704 % had a speed of 12 knots and over, and 92.6 % had a speed of under 12 knots. No information is available as to speeds below 12knots, as in Lloyds and other records vessels below thatspeed are placed in one group, but an analysis is being madeof the actual speed of vessels at the moment of attack. Itis, however, very significant that of all vessels sunk 88 %"nad a speed of less than 12 knots. Meantime, in view of the increasing submerged soeedof enemy submarines it is priraa facia sound to build for a :her speed even at the expense of slightly reduced cargo \%\^\ (5) 5) Now that the arming of merchant vessels and other anti-submarine measures have forced the enemy to adopt the submerged method of attack, it is considered that speed . above 12 knots is one of the greatest, if not the greatest defence against enemy submarines.6) The standard ship being built to the order of the -hipping Controller has a maximum speed of knots only, which is considered too slow for safety under the new form of attack. n n ftp m^wm tat.STATEME12T SHEWINGA/X a.i/J.uu luwj.MOAbove 10,000 tonsBsCo20 knts & over j 19 & under 20 knts IB & uNOc ofVessels!TonnagelOoOOO & above 7000 tonso * oo o oAcBe0;7000 & above 5000 tons Ao coo Bo Co* 9 *o o o5000 & above 4000 tonsAoBoC.0 0 0o o oo * o4000 & above 3000 tons As * * * Bo * * * C * * * *.00 & above 2000 tons.A.BoC.c * oc * oO * .2000 & above 1000 tonsA.B.C...ft . .O . .1000 & above 200 tons A- O Q w i 0 C 4. * I200 -fains and under * 7 228 M 17 15o9g30I No o ofider 19 kntsj l?
